trans-unit.source: Draw a string
Parameters
Handle to a Graphics object
String to be drawn
X coordinate where the string will be drawn

seg-source.mrk: X coordinate where the string will be drawn

target.mrk: X coordinate where the string will be drawn

trans-unit.source: Y coordinate where the string will be drawn

seg-source.mrk: Y coordinate where the string will be drawn

target.mrk: Y coordinate where the string will be drawn

trans-unit.source: [optional] Name of the font to use for drawing

seg-source.mrk: Name of the font to use for drawing

target.mrk: Name of the font to use for drawing

trans-unit.source: [optional] Font size to use for drawing

seg-source.mrk: Font size to use for drawing

target.mrk: Font size to use for drawing

trans-unit.source: [optional] Format flags. Can be one or more of the following:

seg-source.mrk: Can be one or more of the following:

target.mrk: Can be one or more of the following:

trans-unit.source: 0x0001 - Specifies that reading order is right to left

seg-source.mrk: 0x0001 - Specifies that reading order is right to left

target.mrk: 0x0001 - Specifies that reading order is right to left

trans-unit.source: 0x0002 - Specifies that individual lines of text are drawn vertically on the display device

seg-source.mrk: 0x0002 - Specifies that individual lines of text are drawn vertically on the display device

target.mrk: 0x0002 - Specifies that individual lines of text are drawn vertically on the display device

trans-unit.source: 0x0004 - Specifies that parts of characters are allowed to overhang the string's layout rectangle

seg-source.mrk: 0x0004 - Specifies that parts of characters are allowed to overhang the string's layout rectangle

target.mrk: 0x0004 - Specifies that parts of characters are allowed to overhang the string's layout rectangle

trans-unit.source: 0x0020 - Specifies that Unicode layout control characters are displayed with a representative character

seg-source.mrk: 0x0020 - Specifies that Unicode layout control characters are displayed with a representative character

target.mrk: 0x0020 - Specifies that Unicode layout control characters are displayed with a representative character

trans-unit.source: 0x0400 - Specifies that an alternate font is used for characters that are not supported in the requested font

seg-source.mrk: 0x0400 - Specifies that an alternate font is used for characters that are not supported in the requested font

target.mrk: 0x0400 - Specifies that an alternate font is used for characters that are not supported in the requested font

trans-unit.source: 0x0800 - Specifies that the space at the end of each line is included in a string measurement

seg-source.mrk: 0x0800 - Specifies that the space at the end of each line is included in a string measurement

target.mrk: 0x0800 - Specifies that the space at the end of each line is included in a string measurement

trans-unit.source: 0x1000 - Specifies that the wrapping of text to the next line is disabled

seg-source.mrk: 0x1000 - Specifies that the wrapping of text to the next line is disabled

target.mrk: 0x1000 - Specifies that the wrapping of text to the next line is disabled

trans-unit.source: 0x2000 - Specifies that only entire lines are laid out in the layout rectangle

seg-source.mrk: 0x2000 - Specifies that only entire lines are laid out in the layout rectangle

target.mrk: 0x2000 - Specifies that only entire lines are laid out in the layout rectangle

trans-unit.source: 0x4000 - Specifies that characters overhanging the layout rectangle and text extending outside the layout rectangle are allowed to show

seg-source.mrk: 0x4000 - Specifies that characters overhanging the layout rectangle and text extending outside the layout rectangle are allowed to show

target.mrk: 0x4000 - Specifies that characters overhanging the layout rectangle and text extending outside the layout rectangle are allowed to show

trans-unit.source: Return Value
True.
False and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended may contain GPSTATUS error code ($GPID_ERR*).

seg-source.mrk: False and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended may contain GPSTATUS error code ($GPID_ERR*).

target.mrk: False and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended may contain GPSTATUS error code ($GPID_ERR*).

trans-unit.source: Related
Example
Create GUI
GDI+
Draw a string
Hello world
Loop until the user exits.
Clean up resources
